author: Staff Reporter
text:
Neyveli Lignite Corporation Limited (NLC) was honoured with ‘National Golden Peacock Award’ for Corporate Social Responsibility-2015 by the Institute of Directors, New Delhi, consultants on the commercial issues of leading organisations in India, on February 5. The award for NLC in the Mining and Metallurgy Sector was assessed by the chairman of the awards jury Justice M.N.Venkatachaliah, the former Chief Justice of Supreme Court.

NLC stated that the Corporation has been contributing to the welfare of the people of the peripheral villages. Accordingly, basic infrastructure like drinking water, medical facility, roads, bridges, schools, library, place of worship, social welfare centres, etc., were provided by NLC. “In an attempt to raise the ground water table, and water facility for irrigation, the Corporation had taken up the project ‘Jalaparyapatha’ (Water Resource Augmentations). Under this scheme, the Corporation spent Rs.13.72 crore towards desilting the Walajah Tank near Vadalur to facilitate uninterrupted water supply for irrigating 200 villages. Further percolation wells, check dams and artificial recharging of the ground water helped to raise the water table,” said chief general manager.
title: NLC gets National Golden Peacock Award
